channel.title: [Error Fix] When running delta on a mac
channel.description:
Have you ever had this error? [IMG]http://i47.tinypic.com/k2mut.png[/img] This is how to fix it. I've saw a lot of people asking how to do it.
So first, lets take "item.cfg" for example, it will say "item.cfg: file not found." You need to open up the folder "config" and take out "item.cfg" and put it into the main file.
Now open up "ItemHanlder.java" and search for "config\\" and there could be more than one "config\\" so double search it, then replace it with "./"
[size=24pt]Make sure to take npc.cfg, npcdrops.cfg, autospawn.cfg, doors.cfg, shops.cfg, item.cfg, globaldrops.cfg out of your config folder and put them in your main file. [/size]
Look no more "item.cfg: file not found." [IMG]http://i45.tinypic.com/103eykj.jpg[/img]
Save and compile and run. Congratulations, you now have a working delta source for mac. [size=24pt](After you do it with the other ones)[/size]
When it's finished! [IMG]http://i49.tinypic.com/2cqz8kg.png[/img]
[size=24pt]Locations:[/size]
npc.cfg npcdrops.cfg autospawn.cfg
are all in "NPCHandler.java" so there will be three "config\\"
------------------------------------ doors.cfg
is located in DoorHandler.java there is only one "config\\" ------------------------------------ shops.cfg
is located in ShopHandler.java there is only one "config\\" ------------------------------------ item.cfg and globaldrops.cfg
are located in ItemHandler.java there is two "config\\"

item.title: [Error Fix] When running delta on a mac
item.dc:creator: @promagez promagez
item.description:
@promagez wrote:

[quote=“jakeandchase, post:4, topic:461466”]I only mostly have .class files.

It didn’t work for me

Could someone team viewer or check my server if I upload it?[/quote]

What source are you using…?

Read full topic

item.title: [Error Fix] When running delta on a mac
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

I don’t know anything about mac, but I suppose you can’t just run it via a batch.
So i’d suggest you’d add more to this tutorial, everything a mac user needs to know to run their server via mac.
According to your title thats what I and others will expect.

Read full topic

item.title: [Error Fix] When running delta on a mac
item.dc:creator: @promagez promagez
item.description:
@promagez wrote:

Have you ever had this error?

This is how to fix it.
I’ve saw a lot of people asking how to do it.

So first, lets take “item.cfg” for example, it will say “item.cfg: file not found.”
You need to open up the folder “config” and take out “item.cfg” and put it into the main file.

Now open up “ItemHanlder.java” and search for “config\” and there could be more than one “config\” so double search it, then replace it with “./”

[size=24pt]Make sure to take npc.cfg, npcdrops.cfg, autospawn.cfg, doors.cfg, shops.cfg, item.cfg, globaldrops.cfg out of your config folder and put them in your main file. [/size]

Look no more “item.cfg: file not found.”

Save and compile and run.
Congratulations, you now have a working delta source for mac. [size=24pt](After you do it with the other ones)[/size]

When it’s finished!

[size=24pt]Locations:[/size]

npc.cfg
npcdrops.cfg
autospawn.cfg

are all in “NPCHandler.java”
so there will be three “config\”

doors.cfg

is located in DoorHandler.java
there is only one “config\”

shops.cfg

is located in ShopHandler.java
there is only one “config\”

item.cfg and globaldrops.cfg

are located in ItemHandler.java
there is two “config\”
